text: the important thing about customer
service in an age of the web and the
internet is above all be honest and make
expectations realistic don't promise
what you can't deliver don't let your
enthusiasm for your company claim that
service is better than it is take a
company like Amazon you cannot reach a
human being at Amazon well you can but
it's very very hard and yet everybody's
very happy with Amazon's customer
service because Amazon makes it really
clear if you have a problem send us an
email they don't promise that you'll be
able to reach a human operator they do
exactly what they say and that is talk
to us via email I think the most
important thing that a company can do
not just in the customer cust space but
the employee space is to be completely
open and completely honest don't pretend
that you're doing something that you
cannot do there's an old saying in
Silicon Valley it's not a bug it's a
feature and so a lot of companies say
gosh you know we can't talk to our
customers we can't in interact with them
properly that's really a problem well
that may be a feature your customers May
in fact not want to interact with you
and if you're just upfront with
customers that you can't interact with
them they will handle their own customer
service
